Posts.Content: Hey Chuck, I just figured out how to do it just now. Took me a while tho.
Posts.Signature: Biopsy April 2014 4/14 cores pos with 1 of 4 projected Gleason 3+4=7 Pathology Final Report (Surgery 2/23/16): No PC left  Prostate removed All Lymph Nodes Negative 0/30 Final Gleason 3+3=6 (Prev report of 3+4=7) Margins negative for PC Erection 50% after two pills of Sildenafil 20mg Diapers after surgery for about a month Pads - Was actually off pads at the end of August - six months after surgery - 6+ months ahead of schedule Cathether out 8 days. I had to get used to wearing it the 1st couple of days after surgery. 3/2016 - PSA Undetectable 5/2016 - PSA Undetectable 8/2016 - PSA Undetectable 11/2016 - PSA Undetectable 2/2017 - PSA Undetectable PSA 2/15/16 13.0 PSA 11/28/15 11.3 PSA 7/28/15 9.9 PSA 1/19/15 9.7 PSA 12/17/14 9.8 PSA 11/18/14 8.8 PSA 8/25/14 7.4 12/17/2014: PSA FREE ng/mL 0.94 (10%) PCA3 123 (normal 0-24) 12/17/2014 DRE - Smooth, No Nodules, Just Enlarged May Jehovah Bless You Instagram: @Jus2MotivateU Twitter: @Jus2MotivateU
Posts.Title: Diagnosed today and have questions

Posts.Content: Hi, I am very sorry to hear of the diagnosis. I had been dealing with that since I was diagnosed in 2015 but had been trying to prolong it by doing various things. It is very stressful. But looking at the numbers of your husband, I would say the bone scan and CT scan are very necessary. If I were in those same shoes and my numbers were like that I would have no choice but to go thru with those additional tests just so you can be very sure it hasn't spread. I don't know how long you have been married or your ages, but I was 49 when diagnosed last year and will be married 30 years this June. I didn't want to get surgery and though about the seeds. But my wife wanted me here with her and I wanted to be here and if the seeds didn't work, then no surgery could be performed. So I had my surgery last February and I have had a few PSA tests since and it was undetectable. My numbers were not as bad as your husbands but it was to a point where we didn't want it spread. The doctor also played a part in my decision and what made me prolong mine was the two previous doctors that I didn't want to perform surgery on me. They seemed too impatient and this was a big decision. By all means get those tests done. I pray that everything goes well. You can see my numbers on my profile.
